hanzi-su-wiki:
奪

Значения

Отнимать, лишать, захватывать

Мнемоника

Дрофы, крупные 大 птицы 隹, с трудом взлетающие с поля, где клюют зерно. Их можно ловить голыми руками 寸.

Варианты

夺
purpleculture_pinyin:
duó
to seize; to take away forcibly; to wrest control of; to compete or strive for; to force one's way through; to leave out; to lose
захватить; забрать насильно; вырвать контроль; соревноваться или стремиться; пробиваться; оставить; терять
rtega_mnemonic:
奪奪RS
夺夺		take by force, rob, snatch
  • RS. the man 大 who steals 寸 a bird 隹: rob
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 夺)
Antonyms: 送
Ideographic: A man 大 grasping 寸 a bird 隹
purpleculture_examples:
奪得 [ duó dé ]: to take (after a struggle); to wrest; to seize; to capture; to win (a trophy)
奪取 [ duó qǔ ]: to seize; to capture; to wrest control of
奪冠 [ duó guàn ]: to seize the crown; fig. to win a championship; to win gold medal
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿳ Above to middle and below
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
heisig_chinese_memo: Don't let the neighbor's St. Bernard rob tonight's turkey....glue it to the table if you must because the St. Bernard will take by force.
heisig_constituent: rob, large, St. Bernard, turkey, glue
heisig_story: Whereas burglary (Frame 381) implies clandestine appropriation of another's property, robbery refers to taking by force. The primitive elements: St. Bernard dog . . . turkey . . . glue.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: rob, take by force, snatch away, dispossess, plunder, usurp
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: грабят, взять силой, расхватывают, выселить, грабежа, узурпировать
koohiiStory1: Remember the scene in A Christmas Story where the big dogs robbed the family of their Christmas turkey? Well, the following year Ralphie´s mom glued the holiday bird to the kitchen table, just as a precaution.
koohiiStory2: Don´t let the neighbor´s St.Bernard rob tonight´s turkey....glue it to the table if you must.
jp_example_words:
略奪(りゃくだつ): pillage, plunder, looting, robbery
奪う(うばう): snatch away
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A big turkey has to measure a safe before he can rob it. If the safe is too big it won’t fit in his getaway van and the robbery will have been a failure. So before the turkey robs the place he needs to measure the safe.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this turkey as he tries to rob this safe. See him with the tape measure as he determines whether or not the safe is too big.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The safe that the turkey is trying to rob ends up being uber (うば) big. Like, really uber big. So uber big that the turkey can’t even measure it with his tape measure. There’s no way he’s gonna be able to rob this place.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the size of this uber big safe. What could be inside? Probably something good.
Ru_Meaning: rob, take by force, snatch away, dispossess, plunder, usurp
Ru_trainchinese:
duó: (графема) выиграть, одержать победу; отнимать, лишать; принимать решение
duó: (глаг) отнимать, захватывать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the big little bird (奞) was an inch (寸) from being snatched away
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you want to remove a normally glued object from a surface you can just take by force.  But objects attached with this big glue stick with give you a lot more trouble.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from the " clothes " from the " bird " from " and ", " but " like a hand, like the shape of a hand to win birds to the human heart, the original meaning is to snatch strong take. The word " duo " retains many use cases in the inscriptions, such as 敔簋: "Duofu (capture) four hundred people". Means to retake the four hundred captured (Guo Moruo). "poetry. Daya. Paying respect": "Everyone has the people, and the women will take them." " Wins " in the Warring States Period, but also writing the word phonetic word " Duo ," which, " Po " as signifier, armed with sticks shaped like, " against " as the sound character to seize the expression " wins ." "Shuowen": "Twist, force to take it." The word " Twist " was still used until the Tang Dynasty. For example, in Han Yu: "Send Meng Dongye Preface", there is a sentence of "Four Seasons Push Twist". In sum, " wins " as knowing the word, " Duo Phonogram was made after the cut off the feet," In addition, " Yan " is " seize interchangeable characters", the Yinqueshan bamboo "Sun Bin Art of War. "See the King of Power": "I will want to blame benevolence and righteousness, style courtesy and music, dress down, and ban contention." "Competition" means "contention."

Guodian Slips "Ziyi" 38 Jane: "This life is not available to Chi Duo, Duo name can not be dead." (Note: " Duo " now this. "Book of Rites Ziyi" as " wins "), "The Book of Rites" from this phrase It can be seen that, in addition to the main solution to seize, the word " capture " or "敓" can also be extended to "lost" or "nothing." "Shuowen": "To seize, hold the fate of the lost. Congyou, Congyou." Duan Yucai's note: "Extension is the 偁 of all lost things. Anything left in the hand is regarded as this word. Today is used to take off. It's. And use the word "to fight"."

Although the meaning of the word " duo " and "lost" is no longer passed on today, the "Analects of Confucius. "Zihan": "The three armies can win the commander, and the man can't win the ambition" is worthy of the world's careful consideration!
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The elephant hand captures the shape of a bird in the arms of others. The original meaning is to snatch and force.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「衣」從「雀」從「又」，「又」象手形，象手向人懷內奪取雀鳥之形，本義是搶奪、強取。「奪」字於金文中保留了多用例，如敔簋：「奪孚(俘)人四百」。表示奪回被俘虜之四百人(郭沫若)。《詩．大雅．瞻仰》：「人有民人，女覆奪之」。「奪」字於戰國時又可寫作形聲字「敓」，其中，「攴」為意符，象手持棍棒形，「兌」為聲符，用以表達奪取之「奪」。《說文》：「敓，彊取也。」 「敓」字直到唐代仍被使用，如韓愈：《送孟東野序》中即有「四時之相推敓」句。總言之，「奪」為會意字，「敓」刖為後造的形聲字，此外，「挩」是「奪」的通假字，銀雀山竹簡《孫臏兵法．見威王》：「我將欲責仁義，式禮樂，垂衣常，以禁爭挩。」「爭挩」即「爭奪」。

　　郭店楚簡《緇衣》簡38：「此以生不可敓志，死不可敓名。」(按：「敓」今本《禮記．緇衣》作「奪」) 從《禮記》此語可見，「奪」或「敓」字除主要解奪取外，又可引申為「失去」或「沒有」。《說文》：「奪，手持隹失之也。从又、从奞。」段玉裁注：「引伸為凡失去物之偁。凡手中遺落物當作此字。今乃用脫為之。而用奪為爭敓字。」

　　「奪」字「失去」這一義項今天雖已不傳，但《論語．子罕》：「三軍可奪帥也，匹夫不可奪志也」一語，還是值得世人仔細玩味的﹗
humanum_short_description: 象手向人懷內奪取雀鳥之形，本義是搶奪、強取。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
奪 (Simplified: 夺)
Pinyin: duó
English Definition: to seize; to take away forcibly; to wrest control of; to compete or strive for; to force one's way through; to leave out; to lose
Antonyms: 送
Total strokes: 14; Radical: 大
Ideographic: A man 大 grasping 寸 a bird 隹
Character Formation:
  • ⿳ Above to middle and below
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
Example Words:
奪得 [ duó dé ]: to take (after a struggle); to wrest; to seize; to capture; to win (a trophy)
奪取 [ duó qǔ ]: to seize; to capture; to wrest control of
奪冠 [ duó guàn ]: to seize the crown; fig. to win a championship; to win gold medal
More: 奪* | *奪 | *奪*

  • ⿳ Above to middle and below
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
    • 寸 [ cùn ] inch; small, tiny
①搶，強取：搶奪。掠奪。巧取豪奪。強(qiǎng)詞奪理。
②爭先取到：奪得最後勝利。奪魁。奪冠(guàn)。
③衝開：奪門而出。
④喪失，削除：剝奪。褫奪(剝奪)。奪志(改變志向或意願)。
⑤晃動：光彩奪目。
⑥決定如何處理：請予裁奪。
⑦漏掉(文字)：第八行奪一字。

金文從「 衣 」從「 雀 」從「 又 」，「 又 」象手形，象手向人懷內奪取雀鳥之形，本義是搶奪、強取。「 奪 」字於金文中保留了多用例，如敔簋：「奪孚(俘)人四百」。表示奪回被俘虜之四百人(郭沫若)。《詩．大雅．瞻仰》：「人有民人，女覆奪之」。「 奪 」字於戰國時又可寫作形聲字「 敓 」，其中，「 攴 」為意符，象手持棍棒形，「 兌 」為聲符，用以表達奪取之「 奪 」。《說文》：「敓，彊取也。」 「 敓 」字直到唐代仍被使用，如韓愈：《送孟東野序》中即有「四時之相推敓」句。總言之，「 奪 」為會意字，「 敓 」刖為後造的形聲字，此外，「 挩 」是「 奪 」的通假字，銀雀山竹簡《孫臏兵法．見威王》：「我將欲責仁義，式禮樂，垂衣常，以禁爭挩。」「爭挩」即「爭奪」。 郭店楚簡《緇衣》簡38：「此以生不可敓志，死不可敓名。」(按：「 敓 」今本《禮記．緇衣》作「 奪 」) 從《禮記》此語可見，「 奪 」或「 敓 」字除主要解奪取外，又可引申為「失去」或「沒有」。《說文》：「奪，手持隹失之也。从又、从奞。」段玉裁注：「引伸為凡失去物之偁。凡手中遺落物當作此字。今乃用脫為之。而用奪為爭敓字。」 「 奪 」字「失去」這一義項今天雖已不傳，但《論語．子罕》：「三軍可奪帥也，匹夫不可奪志也」一語，還是值得世人仔細玩味的﹗

奪字的基本解释

奪
duó
见“夺”。

奪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［duó］
［《廣韻》徒活切，入末，定。］
“敚1”的今字。“夺1”的繁体字。
(1)强取。
(2)压倒；胜过。
(3)裁定；决定取舍。
(4)竞先取得，争取到。
(5)削除；剥夺。
(6)丧失；失去。
(7)用强力使之动摇、改变。亦谓由于强力而动摇、改变。
(8)犹乱。
(9)遗漏；脱落。
(10)耀。指光线或光采特盛，使人眼花。
(11)“奪情”的省称。古代官员遭父母丧，朝廷命其不离职守制，或丧服未满而召之出仕叫“奪情”，亦简称“奪”。
(12)抄刊古书时的文字脱漏。
(13)即鵽。
[②]［duì］
［《集韻》徒外切，去夳，定。］
“夺2”的繁体字。
狭路。《礼记·檀弓下》：“齊莊公擊莒於奪，杞梁死焉。”郑玄注：“隧、奪聲相近，或爲兑。”陈澔集说：“隧，狹路也。”一说，地名。见《集韵·去夳》。

奪字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【大字部】　奪； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页253第25
〔古文〕??【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?徒活切，音?。彊取也。【前漢·食貨志】大賈富家，不得豪奪吾民。【景帝紀】漁奪百姓。【文中子·王道篇】輕施者必好奪。　又鐫削祿階亦曰奪。【論語】奪伯氏騈邑三百。　又狹路也。【禮·檀弓】齊莊公襲莒于奪。○按《左傳·襄二十三年》齊侯襲莒，杞殖華還載甲，夜入且于之隧。《杜註》：且于，莒邑。隧，狹路。鄭元引之證經云：隧奪聲相。近又云：或作兌，據此則奪非地名。敓，古奪字，兌卽敓之省文。?澔失考，誤音兌，字書因之訓地名，?非。　又丘月切，音闕。【白居易·桐花詩】何此巴峽中，桐花開十月。草木堅彊物，所稟固難奪。　又叶僻吉切，音狄。【大?度首】石赤不奪，節士之必。敚或敓原字从攴。

奪字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
奪字的起名意思

暂无。

Seize
Basic explanation of words
Seize
duó
See "Capture".
Seize
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［duó］
["Guangyun" lively, enters the end, and settles. ]
The present character of "敚1". The traditional characters of "夺1".
(1) Forced take.
(2) Overwhelming; surpassing.
(3) Ruling; Deciding whether to make a decision.
(4) Get first and win.
(5) Elimination; deprivation.
(6) Lost; lost.
(7) Use force to shake and change. It is also said to be shaken and changed due to force.
(8) Still chaotic.
(9) Omission; falling off.
(10) Yao. Refers to the light or brilliance, dazzling.
(11) The name of the province of "love sentiment". In ancient times, officials who were mourned by their parents, the court ordered them not to leave their posts, or they were called to serve as officials when they were not satisfied with their mourning clothes.
(12) The omission of text when copying and publishing ancient books.
(13) That is 鵽.
[②]［duì］

Name meaning

duó, duì
вм. 夺
Radicals: 大, 隹, 寸  (big, turkey, measurement)
Meaning Mnemonic
A big turkey has to measure a safe before he can rob it. If the safe is too big it won’t fit in his getaway van and the robbery will have been a failure. So before the turkey robs the place he needs to measure the safe.
Imagine this turkey as he tries to rob this safe. See him with the tape measure as he determines whether or not the safe is too big.
Reading Mnemonic
The safe that the turkey is trying to rob ends up being uber (うば) big. Like, really uber big. So uber big that the turkey can’t even measure it with his tape measure. There’s no way he’s gonna be able to rob this place.
Imagine the size of this uber big safe. What could be inside? Probably something good.
